name: Gtk-rs
description: Rust bindings and wrappers for GLib, GDK 3, GTK+ 3 and Cairo.

name: Relm
description: Asynchronous, GTK+-based, GUI library, inspired by Elm, written in Rust.

name: qmetaobject-rs
description: The qmetaobject crate is a crate which is used to expose rust object to Qt and QML.

name: rust-qt-binding-generator
description: This code generator gets you started quickly to use Rust code from Qt and QML. In other words, it helps to create a Qt based GUI on top of Rust code.

name: OrbTk
description: The Orbital Widget Toolkit is a multi platform (G)UI toolkit for building scalable user interfaces with the programming language Rust. It's based on the Entity Component System Pattern and provides a functional-reactive API.

name: druid
description: Druid is a new Rust-native UI toolkit, still in early stages. Its main goal is performance, also aiming for small binary size and compile time, fast startup, and very easy build configuration (just cargo run). It is currently Windows-only, but with hope for porting.

name: Webrender
description: GPU renderer for the Web content, used by Servo.

name: Azul
description: A free, functional, IMGUI-oriented GUI framework for rapid development of desktop applications written in Rust, supported by the Mozilla WebRender rendering engine.

name: Conrod
description: An easy-to-use, 2D GUI library written entirely in Rust. It provides an immediate-mode API that wraps a retained-mode widget state graph. This allows us to expose a simple, robust and reactive interface while approaching the performance of traditional, retained GUI frameworks.
